title: (x) "Most Common Sexual Barriers" condensed serif on book cover - Favrile (François) {Mike Y}
content:
I have looked all over and can’t seem to nail this one. The “N” disqualifies every possibility I have. Anybody have any ideas of the font name?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075109im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/barriers_5965.gif)

 [‹ (x) Notícias Magazine constructed geometric sans - Monark {Angel}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075109/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37167 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Impressive" hand written script and dingbat/ornament ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075109/http:/www.typophile.com/node/37160 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rickruss

comments.content:
Favrile. I think Brendel sells it under another name (of course). We’ve discussed this here before.

- Mike Yanega

Yes, [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075109/http:/www.typophile.com/node/18740) is the thread. The alias name Brendel uses is Francois. This has been condensed graphically, I would say.

- Mike Yanega
This font has been morphed abut 50%. You can tell by the football shaped dots.

This shows the sample of [Favrile](http://web.archive.org/web/20071205075109/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/SerifGuide/serifsamples/serif_fg/favrile_full.gif) in the Serif Font ID Guide. The font was designed by Tom Carnase in 1985.

- Mike Yanega
Thank you, thank you, thank you. I would have never figured this out.

\> _This font has been morphed abut 50%. You can tell by the football shaped dots._

Huh? I thought football used round balls? These are shaped like rugby balls... :^P ;^)
Hehe. Only in America Yves. Everywhere else in the world fotball is fotball(Soccer - read not American fotball). The font is definetly squeezed though.

<cite>Hehe. Only in America Yves. Everywhere else in the world fotball is fotball</cite>

Except Canada. We call soccer “soccer”, and either Canadian or American football “football”.

- Lex
Lex: Isn’t that what I said? Canada is a part of America (as in Nothern) just not a part of the US or not?;-)
